title: 112_hr2339
content: The "Lobbyist Disclosure Enhancement Act" may be cited as the short title. Modifications to enforcement are included in the act. The Attorney General establishes the Lobbying Disclosure Act Enforcement Task Force to investigate and prosecute cases under the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995. The Task Force also collects information on enforcement and audits compliance annually. The Lobbying Disclosure Act Enforcement Task Force ensures compliance with the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 by conducting random sampling of lobbying registrations and reports. It also operates a hotline and online mechanism for the public to report noncompliance. Cases of noncompliance are referred to the Attorney General for further action. The Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 is amended to replace "United States Attorney for the District of Columbia" with "Attorney General" in certain paragraphs. The Attorney General can recommend improvements for enforcing the Act and the need for additional resources. Enforcement reports under the Act are also modified. The Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 is amended to replace "United States Attorney for the District of Columbia" with "Attorney General" in certain paragraphs. The Attorney General can recommend improvements for enforcing the Act and the need for additional resources. Enforcement reports under the Act are also modified, including details on individual lobbyists or lobbying firms involved and any sentences imposed. SEC. 3. DEFINITION OF LOBBYIST amended to remove certain language. SEC. 4. Online registration of lobbyists expedited within 5 days. SEC. 5. Lobbyists required to disclose additional information. Section 5(b)(2)(A) of the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 is amended to require lobbyists to list each covered executive and legislative branch official they engaged in lobbying activities with, including the name of the Member of Congress if the official is an employee. The Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 amendment requires lobbyists to list each covered executive and legislative branch official they lobbied, including the name of the Member of Congress if the official is an employee. SEC. 6 amends the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 regarding the disclosure of political contributions, changing the reporting period to quarterly instead of semiannually. SEC. 7 specifies the effective date of the amendment. SEC. 7 specifies the effective dates for the amendments made by the sections of the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995.
